Utility class, that provides static methods for all kind of Collection-related operations.

Method Detail

flattenMap

public static <V> java.util.Collection<V> flattenMap(java.util.Map<V,java.util.Collection<V>> map)

Flattening is the same like Map.values(), with the difference, that value must be a Collection, and corresponding key is added to this collection of values. (at position 0).

Example: 

 final Collection values0 = new ArrayList();
 values0.add("B");
 values0.add("C");
 final Collection values1 = new ArrayList();
 values1.add("E");
 values1.add("F");
 final Map> map = new LinkedHashMap>();
 map.put("A", values0);
 map.put("D", values1);
 final Collection reference = new LinkedHashSet();
 reference.add("A");
 reference.add("B");
 reference.add("C");
 reference.add("D");
 reference.add("E");
 reference.add("F");
        
 reference == {A, B, C, D, E, F}
 CollectionUtils.flattenMap(map) == {A, B, C, D, E, F}

Type Parameters:
V - type of keys and values
Parameters:
map - that is to be flattened
Returns:
the flat map
See Also:
Map
